comments.author: dasia harris

comments.text:
cant believe I got an inspiration...


interesting. tho I really despise the robo limbs..because of 
their impracticability. tho making them more practical would ask lighter 
material than iron or steel. other than that it should be made resemble 
real arm more than it does now, not its just a smaller version of a factory 
robot that places containers on top of each other. than the trickiest part 
is controlling it. moving it with what is left or chess muscles is not very 
practical. the order must come directly from the brain. tricky part is how 
to make the arm do what you want, how to turn the message into action.
this would make it very easy for a soldier to return into his duty even 
with robot arm, tho in that case the arm should be strong enough to handle 
kick. tho that can be fixed with weapon modification, a weapons kick can be 
made less powerful and it can be made non existing. that would also lead to 
other arm versions, such as weapon arms. an arm that ends to a machine gun 
or any form of belt fed gun. the belt comes from the soldiers backpack and 
enters into his arm. it stays stable when soldiers fires it thanks to the 
modifications.
that you lose something of your body should always lead to an upgrade.
of course this kind of super soldier technology should be taken ever 
further, the trouble is that as usual. soldiers seem to have families out 
side waiting for them to come from their service. but of course if this 
technology was taken further, it would asks living subjects and 
experimentation on humans. so the correct answer would be simply tell the 
families bad news and say that their son, husband, father was lost in 
action and dead and cannot be recovered because of reasons.
surely these soldiers are still alive and well, tho I believe they would 
want to see their families. but their opinion no longer matters. eventually 
this super soldier would be really nothing more than lightly armored living 
weapon. arms and legs replaced with robotics, helmet and mask attached 
directly on the bone. blood fill with different kind of steroids and pain 
killers and small potions of more ready to be automatically pushed into its 
flesh in time of need. and self destructive mechanism of course. we would 
not want this technology to fall on enemy hands. the corpse explodes when 
heart stops beating. how does it not do it on base? with a simple remote 
control. if happens so that the body for some reason decides to kill it 
self, the bomb doesnt kill people around it. 

tho wonder if this technology could be taken ever further. the arms and 
legs made bigger and the body supported by bigger hull and heavier armor. 
that would mean heavier guns.

tho we must crush the soldier inside. we must crush his will and his whole 
existence, to make him nothing more than slave who follows orders and kills 
and attacks when commanded. 
tho the problem still is biological parts. eventually the body dies, death 
is part of life as is well known and nobody avoids it. but that is worry of 
bio engineers, they like to play with those stem cells, could for ones make 
something useful of them and not rats with ears growing from their backs. 
how to reanimate a body. would that be scientific brake through or some 
dark magic.﻿

comments.author: GlitchyShadow13

comments.text:
I find this video to be extremely offensive. My sister lost her leg when 
she was 9 years old and now uses a prosthetic leg. She has multiple people 
ask her if she is a cyborg and that is probably by cause of this video. 
Like with do you mean by they're 'cyborgs' they are just normal people 
living a normal life with the help of metal contraptions, hydraulics and 
sometimes computerized limbs and other body parts. They are not classified 
any differently. They are people all the same. do u see any social media 
sites saying choose your sex:
-male
-female
-cyborg 
-other
? no you don't because people aren't classified as cyborgs and they never 
will be. This is not funny, despite what you may think, my sister, and all 
the other amputees and people who need mechanical assistance are NOT 
'cyborgs!" I hope that you +BuzzFeedBlue understand this most of all.


**btw if you are interested in amputees check out the War Amps of Canada 
and their CHAMP program!﻿
